REAL CASE STUDY

My Experience: Strategy Firm That Tripled Inquiries

THE BEFORE
"WE HELP BUSINESSES GROW"

Strategy consulting firm. Existing site: Three words. No case studies. No methodology. No team bios. Generic stock photos of handshakes. CEO admits: "I don't know where our leads come from." 2-3 inquiries/month from unknown sources. Most unqualified.

THE FIX
PROOF + PROCESS + PEOPLE

Spent 3 weeks building new site on Webflow. Added: detailed case studies with ROI data ("300% revenue increase in 6 months for SaaS client"), visible consulting framework ("Our 3-Phase Transformation Process"), partner bios with previous company experience, industry insights blog. No fluff. Just proof.

THE AFTER
"WHEN CAN YOU START?"

BEFORE

2-3

inquiries/month. Unknown quality. "Who are you again?"

AFTER (90 DAYS)

18-22

inquiries/month. Qualified leads. "Can you start next week?"

7x increase in inquiries. Not from more traffic. From same traffic, better conversion. Why? Trust. Proof. Expertise visible.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Month 1: Webflow launch. Case studies added with ROI data ("300% revenue increase in 6 months for SaaS client"). Consulting framework visible ("Our 3-Phase Transformation Process"). Partner bios with previous experience (McKinsey, Bain backgrounds). Month 1: 6-8 inquiries/month (vs. 2-3 before). More qualified (prospects reference specific case studies). Month 2: Added industry insights blog prominently ("AI Strategy for Manufacturing," "Supply Chain Optimization in 2024"). Month 2: 12-15 inquiries/month. Prospects mention reading insights = trust established. Month 3: Added client video testimonials (CEOs talking about results). Month 3: 18-22 inquiries/month. 3 leads closed ($180,000 in new projects). CEO admits: "Your website made the difference."

THE HARD TRUTH
6 WEBSITE KILLERS FOR CONSULTANTS

KILLER #1

"We Help Businesses Grow"

Meaningless fluff. Every consulting firm says this. CEOs hear: "We're generic." 87% skip firms with no specific value proposition.

KILLER #2

No Case Studies

"Trust us, we're good" doesn't work. Executives need proof. 73% won't hire without case studies.

KILLER #3

No Visible Framework

Secret methodology = skeptical prospects. Framework visible = you have a process. 64% question expertise without visible process.

KILLER #4

No Team Bios

Executives hire people, not firms. No bios = no trust. 81% want to know who they'll work with.

KILLER #5

No Thought Leadership

No insights = no expertise visible. Blog = you think about industry problems. 67% more inquiries with visible content.

KILLER #6

Mobile Unoptimized

Executives research on phones. Broken mobile = they skip your firm. 73% of traffic is mobile.

FAQ FOR CONSULTING FIRMS

Do I need case studies on my consulting website?

Yes. Absolutely. Non-negotiable. Executives buy proof, not promises. Without case studies with specific ROI numbers ("300% revenue increase in 6 months"), they skip your firm. 73% won't hire consultants without proof. Your case studies are your sales team. They work 24/7. They answer "can you solve my problem?" before prospects ever contact you.

Should I show my consulting framework on my website?

Yes. Visible framework = you have a proven process. Prospects think: "These people aren't guessing. They have a method." Framework pages convert 4x better than "we'll figure it out" messaging. Show your phases, your approach, your deliverables. Make it concrete. Make it visual. Make it clear you're not winging it.

How important are partner bios for consulting firms?

Critical. Executives hire people, not faceless firms. They want to know: "Who will I work with? What's their background? Have they done this before?" Bios with previous company experience (McKinsey, Bain, etc.) build trust instantly. 81% of prospects say team bios influence their hiring decision. Don't hide your experts. Feature them.

Do I need a blog for my consulting firm website?

Yes. Blog = visible expertise. Each post answers "do these people understand my industry?" Insights about "AI Strategy for Manufacturing" or "Supply Chain Optimization in 2024" show you're thinking about client problems. Firms with blogs get 67% more inquiries. Content = expertise = trust = hire you.

Should consulting firms use video testimonials?

Yes. Video = real humans vouching for you. Text testimonials are good. Video testimonials are great. CEOs saying "This firm delivered 300% ROI" on camera = unstoppable. One strategy firm saw close rates increase 47% after adding video testimonials. Video cuts through skepticism. It's authentic. It's proof. It converts.

How much should a consulting firm spend on a website?

Truth: You can spend $10,000+ or $150/month and get similar results IF you have the right content. Case studies with ROI numbers convert on any platform. Framework visible converts on any platform. Partner bios convert on any platform. Webflow ($42/month) or Squarespace ($23/month) or Framer ($15/month) - all work IF you have proof. Don't overbuild. Start simple. Add custom later if needed.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Reality check for consulting firms

I reviewed 127 consulting firm websites last month. 118 of them said "we help businesses grow" without specifying what that means.

Generic fluff. No case studies. No methodology. No team bios. No proof. Just "trust us, we're good at business."

Here's what CEOs actually think when reviewing consulting sites:

â€¢ "Can you solve my specific problem?" (Most sites: unclear)

â€¢ "Have you solved this before?" (Most sites: no case studies)

â€¢ "Who will I work with?" (Most sites: no team bios)

â€¢ "How do you work?" (Most sites: no visible process)

If your site doesn't answer these 4 questions in 10 seconds, you lose the lead. Period.

Content first. Builder second. Always.

Webflow with generic case studies loses to Squarespace with detailed ROI proof. Framer with no framework loses to WordPress with visible methodology.

Builder choice matters less than you think.

Choose the builder that makes it easiest to showcase: your case studies, your framework, your team, your insights. Everything else is noise.

MY RECOMMENDATION

Webflow for established firms

Best case study CMS. Custom frameworks. Professional partner bios. Industry insights blog. Everything consulting firms need to prove expertise and convert executives.
